openstockflow 0.1.0

Stock-Flow Diagram

Source: R/classes.R
StockFlowDiagram-class.Rd

Represents a complete stock-flow diagram as a functor F: H → FinSet from the primitive category H (with objects stock, flow, link and morphisms u, d, s, t) to the category of finite sets.

Details

The diagram stores both rich objects (stocks, flows, etc.) and the categorical functor representation (stock_ids, morphism maps). The functor data enables categorical operations (composition, stratification) while the rich objects provide user-friendly access.

Morphisms: - u_map: upstream morphism (flow → source stock) - d_map: downstream morphism (flow → target stock) - s_map: source morphism (link → stock/variable) - t_map: target morphism (link → flow)

Slots

stocks

List of Stock objects

flows

List of Flow objects

links

List of Link objects

variables

List of AuxiliaryVariable objects

sumvars

List of SumVariable objects

stock_ids

Integer vector: F(stock) ⊆ ℕ

flow_ids

Integer vector: F(flow) ⊆ ℕ

link_ids

Integer vector: F(link) ⊆ ℕ

u_map

Integer vector: F(u): flow_ids → stock_ids ∪ NA

d_map

Integer vector: F(d): flow_ids → stock_ids ∪ NA

s_map

Integer vector: F(s): link_ids → stock_ids ∪ variable_ids

t_map

Integer vector: F(t): link_ids → flow_ids

interface

Integer vector of exposed stock IDs for composition

metadata

List of user-defined metadata
